metadata.feature_description: Map Active Directory groups to DNN administrator role

observations: Code confirms Admin Role Mapping feature exists: Settings.ascx contains txtAdminRoleMapping TextBox field (lines 74-77)
Configuration.cs stores the setting as portal setting 'AD_AdminRoleMapping' (line 133)
UserController.cs contains ManageAdminRoleMapping method (lines 212-230) that adds/removes users from Admin role based on AD group membership
The DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication extension is visible in Settings > Extensions > Authentication Systems
However, no UI path was found to access the extension's site-specific settings (Settings.ascx) through the modern Persona Bar interface
Clicking the edit icon on the extension row consistently opened the DELETE confirmation dialog instead of the settings panel
The 'Authentication' module (DotNetNuke.Authentication v9.3.2) shows 'In Use: No' and its Site Settings tab only displays permissions, not AD-specific configuration fields
This appears to be a gap in the Persona Bar's ability to expose authentication provider configuration settings
The feature exists in code but cannot be tested via UI as no accessible configuration interface was found
